fields.title: Almond Bread
fields.description: A dairy-free bread for toast and sandwiches
fields.instructions:
Combine dry ingredients in a large bowl.

Add wet ingredients and whisk until well combined.

Pour into a silicone loaf pan, or a loaf pan lined with parchment paper.

Bake at 350F for 45-60 minutes.
fields.ingredients:
150g almond flour

3/4 tsp xanthan gum

3/4 tsp sea salt

2 tsp baking powder

6 eggs

3 TB white wine vinegar

1 TB tahini

1/4 c olive oil

fields.title: Fruit Cobbler
fields.description: Baked cobbler topped with grain-free dumplings
fields.instructions:
• Preheat oven to 350F
  • Stir together dry ingredients
  • Add wet ingredients
  • Put fruit into a glass or ceramic oven dish
  • Use a spoon to scoop dollops of topping over the fruit
  • Sprinkle with cinnamon
  • Bake for 40 minutes or until golden brown
fields.ingredients:
• 150g almond flour
  • 1/2 c chopped almonds
  • 1/2 tsp baking soda
  • 1/4 tsp salt
  • 1/2 tsp cinnamon
  • 1/4 tsp nutmeg

 

  • 4 TB butter, melted
  • 1 1/2 TB honey
  • 1 egg
  • 1 1/2 tsp vanilla extract
  • 3 TB Greek yogurt

 

  • 1 lb fruit - blackberries or a mix of berries
fields.image_alt: A dish of baked fruit cobbler

fields.title: Blini
fields.description: Small pancakes to top with creme fraiche and caviar
fields.instructions:
• Mix dry ingredients in a large bowl, and wet ingredients in another bowl/
  • Add some of the wet ingredient mixture to the dry, and whisk until there are no lumps.
  • Add the rest of the wet mixture and whisk to combine. It should be a thin batter. Add water as needed, to thin.
  • Heat a large pan or griddle on the stovetop.
  • Drop by spoonfuls onto the pan, forming 2" (5cm) rounds.
  • When bubbles form on top, flip the pancakes.
  • Cook until both sides are browned and the pancake is cooked through.
  • Remove to a plate and add the next batch to the pan.
  • When the blinis are cool, top with creme fraiche, dill, and caviar or smoked fish.
fields.ingredients:
• 1 c (100g) fine blanched almond flour
  • 1/2 tsp xanthan gum
  • 1/2 tsp sea salt
  • 1 tsp baking powder

 

  • 4 eggs, beaten
  • 2 tsp white wine vinegar
  • 4 TB melted coconut oil or butter
  • 1 TB water or as needed
fields.image_alt: A plate of blinis topped with caviar and salmon

fields.title: Nut granola
fields.instructions:
• Preheat oven to 300F.
  • Stir dry ingredients together, add wet ingredients and stir to combine well.
  • Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
  • Bake for 20 mins until browned, flip the pieces and bake another 20 minutes or more until browned and dry, checking every 10 minutes.
  • Drizzle with maple syrup, sprinkle with more cinnamon.
  • Cool on a rack. Store in an airtight jar.
fields.ingredients:
• 250g sliced almonds
  • 200g pecans
  • 100g pumpkin seeds
  • 150g flax seeds
  • 100g shredded coconut
  • 1 1/2 TB cinnamon
  • 1/8 tsp ground cloves
  • 1 tsp nutmeg
  • 2 tsp ground ginger
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 2 TB psyllium husks

 

  • 1 tsp vanilla extract
  • 1/2 cup flaxseed oil
  • Two eggs, beaten

 

  • 1/4 cup maple syrup
  • Cinnamon

fields.title: Seed Cake
fields.instructions:
This recipe is inspired by the less-sweet coffee cakes flavored with citrus, rosewater, and caraway seeds before vanilla flavoring became widely available.

  • Preheat oven to 350F and grease a bundt pan or line a loaf pan with parchment paper.
  • Mix dry ingredients.
  • Add wet ingredients and whisk together.
  • Pour into prepared pan.
  • Bake for 45-60 minutes, until browned and cooked through.
  • Cool on a rack for ten minutes, remove from pan and cool thoroughly.
  • Serve with berries.
fields.ingredients:
• 1 cup almond flour 
  • 2/3 cup coconut flour
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 1 1/2 tsp cinnamon
  • 1/8 tsp ground cloves
  • 1/2 tsp nutmeg
  • 1/4 cup caraway seeds
  • 2 tsp baking powder
  • 1/2 tsp xanthan gum

 

  • 5 eggs
  • 1/2 cup yogurt
  • 2 tsp vanilla
  • 1 tsp rosewater
  • juice and zest of one lemon
  • 1 cup water
fields.image_alt: Bundt cake cooling on a rack

fields.title: Blintzes
fields.description: Fill with cheese or berries, or use as crepes.
fields.instructions:
To make the filling:

  • Place the cottage cheese in a colander lined with cheeseclothe or a towel for 30 minutes, while you are cooking the pancakes. Squeeze out any excess liquid and  place in a small bowl. Stir in the egg, salt, and lemon zest.

To make the pancakes:

  • Mix the dry ingredients.
  • Add a little milk and whisk until there are no lumps.
  • Add the rest of the wet ingredients and whisk to form a thin batter.
  • Heat a large nonstick pan on the stovetop and add oil or butter.
  • Pour 1/4 cup of the batter into the pan and swirl to spread evenly.
  • When the pancake is firm and golden brown underneath, flip with a spatula and brown on the other side.
  • Remove to a plate, and continue with the rest of the batter.

To fill:

  • Place a pancake on the work surface and add about 2 TB of filling along one end.
  • Fold in the sides, and roll into a firm log.
  • Place the blintzes seam side down in the pan, and cook for a few minutes, then flip and brown the other side. 
  • Remove to a plate to keep warm.
  • Serve with sour cream and/or applesauce.
fields.ingredients:
Pancakes:

  • 3 tbsp coconut flour
  • 3 tsp arrowroot powder
  • 1/4 tsp sea salt

 

  • 6 eggs
  • 1/2 cup milk of choice, divided
  • 4 tbsp melted coconut oil or butter
  • 1/2 tsp vanilla extract

Cheese filling:

  • Cottage cheese or farmer's cheese
  • 1 egg
  • Pinch of salt
  • Zest of one lemon

fields.title: Bagels
fields.description: Soft  and delicious bagels made with cheese
fields.instructions:
• Preheat the oven to 350F and line a baking pan with parchment paper.
  • Melt the mozzerella in the microwave or in a pan on the stovetop, stirring often.
  • Add the cream cheese and vinegar and stir to combine.
  • Put the cheese into a bowl, add 2 beaten eggs and stir.
  • Add the dry ingredients and stir or knead until smooth.
  • Divide the dough into six balls. Make a hole in the center of each ball, and form into a bagel shape.
  • Pour sesame or poppy seeds on to a plate, in a thin layer.
  • Brush the tops with the remaining beaten egg, and dip into the seeds.
  • Place on the baking pan and bake for 20 minutes, or until risen and golden brown.
  • Cool on a rack.
fields.ingredients:
• 1 package shredded mozzarella
  • 2 TB cream cheese 
  • 2 tsp white vinegar 

 

  • 3 eggs, beaten (divided)

 

  • 1/2 cup coconut flour
  • 1/2 tsp salt
  • 2 tsp baking powder 
  • 3/4 tsp xanthan gum
  • Sesame or poppy seeds, to top

fields.title: Knish
fields.description: The classic savory snack pastry, with veg, meat, or dairy filling
fields.instructions:
• Preheat the oven to 325F.
  • Mix the dry ingredients in a large bowl.
  • Add the wet ingredients, stir and knead to combine. Add water if the dough is too stiff.
  • Divide into 6 pieces, and roll each one into a 5" circle between two sheets of plastic wrap or parchment paper.
  • Place 1-2 TB filling in the center of each circle and pinch together, almost closing the knish.
  • Place on a parchment-lined baking sheet, brush with egg and/or sprinkle with black pepper if desired, and bake for 20-30 minutes, until golden brown.

Filling:

  • Mash all ingredients together to combine well.
fields.ingredients:
For the dough:

  • 100 g almond flour
  • 25 g coconut flour
  • 1 tsp xanthan gum
  • 1 tsp baking powder
  • 1/4 tsp salt
  • 1 TB apple cider vinegar
  • 1 egg
  • Water as needed

Sweet potato filling:

  • 1 sweet potato, cooked
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 1 tsp coriander
  • 1/4 tsp cumin
  • salt and pepper
